text: @phoenix.glover_ that makes sense, I think the movement can fight for men’s rights, as a lot of men are feminist, but over all feminism is more about spreading awareness and problems for men. It is more about making everyone aware of the problems to fix them

@feminist409 I agree. In thoery having one movement for equality would be great however becuse society is made up of men and women (also other, but for the sake of simplicity I will only mention the two) there exists a need for two sides to represent their group and their opinions/movements and furthermore to foster a intellectual and productive discussion. Simply having one group would lead to in-fighting and disparity in group veiws. This relates to my statement regarding femisim speaking for mens issues. I belive its fair to say that the majority of pepole who identify as a feminist also identify as female and due to this i dont belive that they could (holistically) speak for mens rights/issues. Much like a man cannot effectivly speak to females issues and understand in the depth that a female may be able to. Because he himslef does not experience those issues as he is a male.

@phoenix.glover_ I definitely understand where you are coming from, but everything must evolve and change. We still need to fight for women’s rights, but as things have gotten better for women, men have also suffered from prejudice. Why I still call myself a feminist and not egalitarian, is because the movement also empowers women. Egalitarianism can not empower everyone because everyone must be equal, but sometimes certain areas need more of something. This why feminism fights for everyone, but it helps people in certain areas. It is not repurposing, it is simply evolving the movement to make it better in modern times

@feminist409 old comment ik. But the word itself implys that it only fights for women's rights. Even if most feminists want equality. Its in the name... Also claiming that feminism fights for mens rights is simply dismissive and reducing to the issue. Personally i dont think that femisim does or furthermore should fight for mens rights. Because the movement was created to help women not men. To some degree i find it insulting as repurposing femisim for mens rights or adding it into the same movement implys that mens rights are not as important as female rights as men are added as an "afterthought" so to speak.

@jtgbklyn the commercial already has made national headlines, I also hope they make one about toxic femininity. If that behaviour is “men just being men” there is a large problem, because that means that violence, cat calling, sexual assault, and bullying are just something men do. I think the add had such a huge backlash because men we not comfortable being told, especially by the media, that something they are doing is bad. No hard feelings either, have a good day.

@feminist409 Ah huh. If it were a commercial about women's bad behavior and the shoe was on the other foot, I would make National headlines. Men have behaviors to correct. I'll give you that. But making fun of "men just being men" just emasculates us which creates more resistance. Look at how much negative blowback the ad got. Why do you think that was? This is my last comment. No hard feelings and good luck.
@jtgbklyn it didn’t tear men down, it showed that the behaviour is bad, and it showed men fixing the situation, it is supposed to be inspirational. Everything in the commercial was bad

@feminist409 Right but if you want to resolve a problem you don't do it by tearing one of the parties involved down. You do it by open dialogue. I also don't agree with some of the behaviors that they depicted were "bad". I do them and they're harmless.
@kielp91 ❤️
@dhrusus no it obviously doesn’t fix the problem, but it shares issues that need to be talked about, and opens discussions.
@dhrusus it is, but believe what you want

@kielp91 We do get lower prison time, but we are also less likely to murder, abuse, rape, or assault. Society sucks, both genders get screwed over. We have also been told by society how we need to fix ourselves.
@kielp91 feminism today isn't for equality

@feminist409 it's girls and women who need be held accountable. Men face far more harsh sentences for equal crimes, when compared to women. We are more likely to be convicted. We are more likely to be charged with a crime, as well, when looking at all factors being the same. I messaged you the facts. And they prove it is girls and women who get away with pretty much everything they want.

@feminist409 and girls never will be. Which is Why girls get away with assaulting and sexually harassing boys and young men, constantly. Or bullying them. Or each other. Girls and women are vicious to one another. Far more so than boys or young men ever could be. And in this hyper sensitive, safe space ridden, believe whatever a female says at the expense of any male society we have now I really don't see girls or women ever being held accountable. You want to talk about boys and men being held accountable?!?!?! I'll share some facts with you.

@feminist409 that's my point. We already know to stop others from doing bad things. I think they could've talked about other issues. Sexual harassment is bad, but we know not to do it, so this ad just doesn't make sense. If a rapist sees an ad to stop raping, they're gonna keep going. Making a commercial doesn't solve anything
@kielp91 agreed
@feminist409 sorry I was trying to reply to @blockchainking
@kielp91 bus can be whoever they want to be. Boys will also be held responsible for their actions
@feminist409 well, boys will be boys. And that's a pretty good thing.
You know what needs to change? Feminism. It needs to end.

@dhrusus it is saying that men need to stop others from doing these bad things. Women have been told for decades how to improve themselves. I hope @gillette makes a commercial about women because we have a lot of problems that need to be talked about
@feminist409 also, I never said that stoping harassment is stupid, this ad makes us men seem stupid because we need a ad to show us that sexual harassment is bad.

@feminist409 it's always men though. Always been, "the girls never do anything wrong". Even in todays society, if someone's being wrong, it's men. If gillet wanted to make a difference, than they should've made one part with woman. If I can, what gender r u?
@dhrusus from what I saw of the add, I say men fighting bullying, fighting sexual harassment, fighting violence. If you think that is stupid, I cannot help you

@feminist409 no it doesn't, because this just shows as if men are stupid. If someone's doing something's wrong, I'm gonna talk about it, or do something. This ad focused on a minority things rather than a majority.
@dhrusus it doesn’t mean that they are indefinitely caused by men, but they effect men directly. I think the commercial put men in a positive light

@dhrusus it actually highlights good men at the end of commercial, it shows them helping people. The commercial is about problems in society that don’t only affect men, but everyone. When I watched the commercial, I din’t think “men is horrible” I thought about the problems that need to be fixed. I think you are focused on the wrong thing in the commercial
@feminist409 this shows that all problems are caused by men. They could have done this way better but this was just wrong

It makes men seem like horrible people, yes there are bad men out there but the majority are fine. If they wanted equality, why didn't they show any female part? They have female products? Plus gillet itself is known by lots of women. I know very well that hurting people is wrong, I don't need a commercial to tell me what I need to do with my life
@deadwhitedoves_ben those are problems, but it is talking about the problems of society and how we cannot brush them off, but we need to stop them

@jtgbklyn no it doesn’t, it talks about how everyone needs to watch for these things, and help the problems not spread to the next generation, this commercial happened to be about men. It also shows men helping people, and stopping these problems.
It puts men down & makes it seem like every problem in the world is our fault, nothing on the women's side.
They could start it with false rape allegations, limited access for fathers or earlier retirement?
@blockchainking me also!
Excited to see how they portray women in their next advert #equality
